item.text: You can select items and navigate documents either by using toolbar buttons or by using keyboard shortcuts.

textXML.div: You can select items and navigate documents either by using toolbar buttons or by using keyboard shortcuts.

item.text: The relevant toolbar buttons for navigation are [Back], [Forward], [Level Up] and [Follow Link]

textXML.div: The relevant toolbar buttons for navigation are [Back], [Forward], [Level Up] and [Follow Link]

item.text: [Back] and [Forward] work in the same way as the back and forward buttons in web browsers.

textXML.div: [Back] and [Forward] work in the same way as the back and forward buttons in web browsers.

item.text: The [Level Up] button will most of the time behave in the same way as the [Back] button. However, the back button will always display the previously 'visited' page, while the [Level Up] button will always display the 'mother' document of the currently viewed documents. The 'mother' document of a document is the document from which it was created using the Linnk! function.

textXML.div: The [Level Up] button will most of the time behave in the same way as the [Back] button. However, the back button will always display the previously 'visited' page, while the [Level Up] button will always display the 'mother' document of the currently viewed documents. The 'mother' document of a document is the document from which it was created using the Linnk! function.

item.text: The [Follow Link] button is only active if an item is selected, on which the Linnk action has been performed (so it is linked to another document).

textXML.div: The [Follow Link] button is only active if an item is selected, on which the Linnk action has been performed (so it is linked to another document).

item.text: TIP: You can also see the associated keyboard shortcuts for actions by browsing the Menu.

textXML.div: TIP: You can also see the associated keyboard shortcuts for actions by browsing the Menu.

item.text: Select the item below the currently selected item: Ctrl + Down Arrow

textXML.div: Select the item below the currently selected item: Ctrl + Down Arrow

item.text: Select the item before the currently selected item: Ctrl + Up Arrow

textXML.div: Select the item before the currently selected item: Ctrl + Up Arrow

item.text: (Remeber that while Ctrl + Arrows helps to switch between items, Alt + Arrows creates new items)

textXML.div: (Remeber that while Ctrl + Arrows helps to switch between items, Alt + Arrows creates new items)
